action.action-desc: Mr. Boswell (for himself, Mr. Loebsack, Mr. Braley of Iowa, Mr. Michaud, Mr. Shuler, Mr. Patrick J. Murphy of Pennsylvania, Mr. Etheridge, Mr. Altmire, Mr. Reyes, Mr. Thompson of California, Mr. Filner, Mr. Ellsworth, Mr. Boyd of Florida, Mr. Kagen, Mr. Moore of Kansas, Ms. Bean, Mr. Scott of Virginia, Mr. Baca, Mr. Barrow, Ms. Herseth Sandlin, Mr. Marshall, Mr. Frank of Massachusetts, Mr. Edwards, Mr. Davis of Illinois, Mr. Rush, and Mr. Towns) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to conduct a study on suicides among veterans.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Suicide Study Act.

paragraph.text: Suicide among the veteran population is a serious problem.
There is lack of information on the number of veterans who commit suicide each year.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall conduct a study to determine the number of veterans who have committed suicide between January 1, 1997 and the date of the enactment of this Act.
In carrying out the study under subsection (a) the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall coordinate with—

paragraph.text: States public health offices and veterans agencies.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall submit to Congress a report on the study required under subsection (a) and the findings of the Secretary.
There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this Act.
